column4: On Ubuntu Server, how would I most easily configure it to avoid certain processes gaining 100% CPU usage (effectively locking everyone out of the system)? Could this be done using limits? All I've found is limiting CPU time...
you need to make some proccess have lower priority, linux servers aremeant too be able too have several proccess running at 100% cpu time, and not adversly affect the system
Yeah, but adjusting priority for every single process that will ever run seems a tad... tedious. Or should I just set login & bash to a negative prio?
you can easily set the priorities of a few proccesses, as its unlikely that they ALL will be taking 100% cpu all the time ;)
